clinical_study.brief_title: Early Treatment With Dexamethasone in Mild Acute Pancreatitis
clinical_study.official_title: Intravenous Dexamethasone for the Early Treatment of Mild Acute Pancreatitis: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This pilot trial will evaluate the following in patients with acute pancreatitis:
1. Safety profile of early treatment with intravenous dexamethasone
2. Impact of dexamethasone on systemic inflammation in patients with acute pancreatitis
3. Provide preliminary data on potential impact of early treatment with steroids on clinical outcomes

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Systemic Inflammation (measured by c-reactive protein level)
primary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein (CRP) is a well-established inflammatory prognostic marker in acute pancreatitis. Primary comparison will be between median CRP levels at 48 hours between treatment arms.

secondary_outcome.description: We will monitor for incidence of malignant hyperglycemia (blood sugar>400 mg/dL), psychosis or culture-documented infectious complications.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 14 days from hospital admission
secondary_outcome.description: A composite clinical endpoint including development of either 1) pancreatic necrosis, 2) persistent organ dysfunction defined according to Atlanta symposium criteria 3) requirement for treatment in an intensive care unit and/or 4) development of culture-documented infection will be used to evaluate impact of treatment with dexamethasone on clinical outcomes in the study population.

arm_group.description: Subjects randomized to intervention arm will receive single dose of 10 mg intravenous dexamethasone.
Equal volume of normal saline administered as a single intravenous dose at enrollment.

intervention.description: 10 mg intravenous given as single administration with optional repeat dose after 36 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age>=18 years
- Diagnosis of acute pancreatitis confirmed by at least 2 of the following:
1. Typical epigastric abdominal pain
2. Elevation amylase/lipase >3 times upper limit normal and/or
3. Confirmatory findings on cross-sectional imaging
- Enrollment within 8 hours of presentation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Class II or greater NYHA heart failure
- Oxygen dependent COPD
- Chronic kidney disease>stage 2
- Cirrhosis
- Existing necrosis on abdominal CT
- Organ dysfunction prior to enrollment
- Sepsis
- Acute respiratory distress syndrome
- Malignancy not in remission for at least 5 years
- Active drug use
- Known allergy to dexamethasone
- Altered mental status
- Insulin-requiring diabetes
- Abdominal surgery within 60 days
